intro: Phyllagathis scorpiothyrsoides, commonly known as the scorpion-thyrsoid piper, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes many species of climbing plants and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
